intro: Nonea sibthorpiana, commonly known as the Sibthorpian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Nonea sibthorpiana is also known for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the Apocynaceae family.
